sentences.english: The old minister paid great attention to everything, that he might be able to repeat it to the Emperor on his return.
sentences.chinese: 老大臣非常关注细节，以保回去之后可以对皇帝重述。

sentences.english: You can also practise scanning for paraphrases of key words.
sentences.chinese: 还可以通过意译重述关键词进行关键词转换练习。
重述你适合这份工作的原因。

sentences.english: Each person who retold Pygmalion didsomething both original
sentences.chinese: 每个人在重述卖花女时都是在做一种原创的东西。

sentences.english: This would include items from the liturgy that are reworded for the children.
sentences.chinese: 这将包括为孩子重述礼拜仪式条款。

sentences.english: He recapitulated the main points of the speech.
sentences.chinese: 他把讲话的重点扼要重述了一遍。

sentences.english: Your phone number again?I didn't quite catch it.
sentences.chinese: 再重述一下你的电话号码好吗？我没记下来。

sentences.english: This exercise readdresses how to gather requirements and create use cases from them.
sentences.chinese: 该练习再次重述了如何收集需求并由它们来创建用例。

sentences.english: This seems to me only re-stating the fact in dignified language.
sentences.chinese: 由我看来，这不过是用修饰词句把事实重述罢了。

sentences.english: Restatement of the Law, Second, Contracts.
sentences.chinese: 法律重述，第二次，合同法。

sentences.english: Stated in F&SF as being retold from the Sir Richard Burton translation in "A Thousand Nights and a Night".
sentences.chinese: 等于是一千零一夜寓言的重述，原发的时候说明了的。

sentences.english: The sixth chapter is to improve our country's financial restatements system.
sentences.chinese: 最后一部分是完善我国财务重述制度的建议。

sentences.english: Mona recounted to Isaacson her first encounter with Jobs.
sentences.chinese: 莫娜向艾萨克森重述了和乔布斯第一次见面的过程。

sentences.english: It will be helpful to recapitulate them.
sentences.chinese: 在这里将其简要重述一下也是有帮助的。

sentences.english: Conclude your business calls with professional courtesy and recapping information.
sentences.chinese: 终结你的业务电话礼貌和专业信息重述。

definition: to repeat (one's own words or sb else's)/(in the classroom) to paraphrase what one has learned
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
to relate (a story or information)/to tell or talk about/to recount/narration/telling/narrative/account
to expound (a position)/to elaborate (on a topic)/to treat (a subject)
to cite/to quote/to cite as evidence
to recount what happened prior to events already known
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
